thread.title: Trojans cross-country finishes third at division meet
thread.title_full: Trojans cross-country finishes third at division meet

author: hdmoadmin
title: Trojans cross-country finishes third at division meet
text:
9:52 am - October 21, 2015 Trojans cross-country finishes third at division meet On the left, Bryce Odegard wearing maroon with a bandana runs with his teammate to the right of him, Layron Sonerholm at the Sunset League Finals on Saturday. Special to the Pahrump Valley Times At the Sunset League Finals, the third maroon runner with dark glasses is Trojans runner, Stephen Thelaner, who is followed by Dylan Montgomery. Special to the Pahrump Valley Times By Vern HeePahrump Valley Times 
The Trojans cross-country boys team took third at the Southern Nevada Division Finals at Craig Ranch Park on Saturday. 
The Trojans competed against five other teams, Faith Lutheran, Clark, Cheyenne, Spring Valley and Sierra Vista. Faith Lutheran took first place (40 points), Clark took second (48 ) and Pahrump Valley (62) was third. 
Bryce Odegard once again led his team with a second-place showing (16 minutes and 26 seconds), which was his best time in a meet this year. The time was also noteworthy because he earned the "Elite Athlete Award", which is given to runners who run under 16:30. 
Trojans coach Matt Kolodzieczyk was surprised by the award but not by Odegard's performance. 
"I really didn't think that Odegard would earn this award so soon in his career," the coach said. "I thought he would do this in his junior or senior year, but he has really worked hard this year." 
Kolodzieczyk now has to get his team past SECTA at the regional meet if his boys are to go to state. They were the divisional champions of the Sunrise League. In open competition, SECTA finishes behind Faith Lutheran and Clark and has lost to Pahrump Valley before. 
"I compared our times to their times," Kolodzieczyk said. "And when I did it, we still finished behind them. I am hoping since the regionals on Oct. 30 will be a fast field, that it will pull our runners up." 
Odegard's time put him as the third best cross-country runner in the state. 
He was also surprised with the award. 
"I remember seeing an athlete win this last year," he said. "So it was a goal of mine but has been in the back of my mind. I thought about it more after our meet at Foothill." 
Layron Sonerholm finished behind Odegard in sixth place (17:36), which was his personal best too. Sergio Sanchez finished in 14th place (18:15.5), Cole Goodman finished 19th (18:44), Stephen Thelaner finished in 21st (18:59) and Dylan Montgomery finished in 32nd (20:16). 
Girls cross-country also finished in third. Faith Lutheran finished in first place (15 points) and Cheyenne finished in second (65) and Pahrump (86) was third. 
Fenny Descuatan finished in 10th place (23:16), Alicia Quiroz finished in 14th place (24:02) and Cambria Forrey finished in 22nd (26:13). 
For the boys to make state they have to finish in the top three places at the regional meet on Oct. 30 at Veterans Park in Boulder City at 7 a.m. 
Contact reporter Vern Hee at vhee@pvtimes.com . Follow @vernheepvt on Twitter.
